This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"checkPolicyTrigger((uint256,address,string,string,uint256,string,string,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,uint8,uint256,uint256),(string,string,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,uint256,string,uint256,string,string))":{"details":"Check if a policy should be triggered based on flight status","params":{"policy":"Policy data","status":"Flight status data"},"returns":{"_0":"triggered Whether the policy should be triggered"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"getFlightStatus(string)":{"details":"Get flight status","params":{"flightNumber":"Flight number"},"returns":{"_0":"Flight status data"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"invalidateFlightData(string)":{"details":"Invalidate flight data","params":{"flightNumber":"Flight number to invalidate"}},"isFlightDataValid(string)":{"details":"Check if flight data is valid","params":{"flightNumber":"Flight number"},"returns":{"_0":"valid Whether the data is still valid"}},"pause()":{"details":"Pause the contract"},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setDataValidityPeriod(uint256)":{"details":"Set data validity period","params":{"_dataValidityPeriod":"New validity period in seconds"}},"setMaxDelayThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"Set maximum delay threshold","params":{"_maxDelayThreshold":"New maximum delay in minutes"}},"setPolicyRegistry(address)":{"details":"Set policy registry address","params":{"_policyRegistry":"New policy registry address"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"unpause()":{"details":"Unpause the contract"},"updateFlightStatus((string,string,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool,bool,uint256,string,uint256,string,string))":{"details":"Update flight status from oracle","params":{"status":"Flight status data"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. fs/QmNYWGGqyzYdk2RMbERWuNKn4eGtd8nAoo6sNoYZ1w99f5"]}},"version":1}

checkPolicyTrigger((uint256,address,stri.details: Check if a policy should be triggered based on flight status

returns._0: triggered Whether the policy should be triggered

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

isFlightDataValid(string).details: Check if flight data is valid

returns._0: valid Whether the data is still valid

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
